result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen William Mark Landis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia. 

No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

SAFE program intake assessment and counseling with follow through.   

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  

DNA sample.

 60/90/120 day probation review hearings.  

2 days credit if revoked.

Probation review hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Case Called:  2:51 p.m. 
INCLUDES 20CF1393, 21CM30, 22CF338.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. Defendant appears in person, and with Atty Peter Vu.

Date and time set for FPT; VRCW. 
Atty Vu advises they have an agreement.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed,
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

20CF1393>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine <=3g/Second and Subsequent Offense/Repeater) and Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.
21CM30>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia); COURT GRANTS. 
22CF338>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater) and Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT GRANTS. 

PLEA: 
20CF1393 Count 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater): GUILTY.  

21CM30 Count 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer): NO CONTEST.  

22CF338 Count 2 (Battery/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA):  NO CONTEST.  
22CF338 Count 3 (Disorderly Conduct/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA): NO CONTEST.  

COURT ORDERS on Misdemeanor counts: SWH for 1 year probation; concurrent with each other. 
COURT ORDERS on all Felony counts:  SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with each other.  

CONDITIONS on 20CF1393 and 21CM30: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.   No drug paraphernalia.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  60 days MCJ I/S for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  

CONDITIONS on 22CF338:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program intake assessment and counseling with follow through.   Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.   No drug paraphernalia.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  90 days MCJ I/S for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharges.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings.  COURT grants 2 days credit if revoked.  

Probation review hearing>>8/05/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  3:10 p.m.
